string.text: Major Dikterev, SBU. Arrived to investigate the failure of Operation Farwater.
Stalkers helped get to Pripyat.
Leave it Captain, let him go.
I have information for Kowalski, take me to him.
Follow me.
All right, follow me.
Guns on the ground! Now!
Yeah, it's a friendly bunch.
All right, fuck it.
You! Freeze!
Who are you? Why do you want the colonel?
I knew it wasn't that simple!
Don't shoot! I'm Lieutenant Sokolov! Scuttle 4! Co-pilot! Proceeding to point B-28!
You know Kowalski?
You thought we were just walking around here, didn't you? Why the expensive barrel? Can't you see we're our own, we're with a comrade we've been through everything. It's been a long road.
I don't care who works for who.
And the SSSU, too!
WITHOUT ME!
I don't do business with the military!
SBU? What the fuck?
Comrade Major, if there's anything you need, you go to the Colonel.
You should probably see the colonel, Comrade Major, not me.
If you need anything, contact Colonel Kovalevsky.
You talk to Kovalevsky, Comrade Major.
You don't come to me, Comrade Major, you come to Ovalsky.
Comrade Major, you, you talk to Kowalski.
Attention! This is Colonel Kowalski. The base has been attacked. Debt of stronification of the threat. Entry is impossible.
Subtitle Editor A. Semkin
Subtitle Editor N. Novikova Corrector V. Sukhiashvili
Missing_Subtitle
Attention! This is Colonel Kowalski. The threat to the base has been eliminated.
Attention. This is Colonel Kowalski. The ejection is over.
Attention! This is Colonel Kowalski. According to instrument readings, the ejection is approaching. Take cover immediately!
Attention! This is Colonel Kowalski. The ejection has begun. Repeat, we're starting to release. Everybody take cover now!

We thank thee for revealing to thy servants the evil-doers of thy servants ours. And by thy shining light the souls of those who gave their lives in fulfilment of your will, to fight, defenders of the monolith, to fight with a vengeance of our fallen brethren, blessed be the eternal their unity with the monolith is death, the fierce death of them, who rejects its sacred power.
They'll notice you so much, Tasch Major!
They'll notice you so much, Comrade Major!
All clear! Let's go!
All clear! Let's go!
Let's wait till they get to the centre of the yard.
Let's wait till they get to the centre of the yard.
There's a style!
There's a target!
They're getting away!
They're getting away!
Don't be stupid, we're about to be spotted! Fire!
Don't bludgeon, we're about to be spotted! Fire!
Ait to the roof, the rest of you follow me.
Ice to the roof. The rest of you, follow me.
All hands in position!
All hands in position!
Standing by for attack command, Touch Major.
Waiting for the command to attack, Comrade Major!
This is bullshit! Is someone leaking our plans to them? Yes, we need to report to Ovalsky.
It's a kirnya. Who's leaking our plans to them? Yes. We have to report to Kowalski.
Ambush! Cover-up!
Ambush! Cover!
Nice shot by Touch Major.
Nice shot by Touch Major!
Let's check them out! Asya, you're covering!
Let's check them out! Ice, you're covering!
Hey, those aliens knew about us!
Hey, those aliens knew about us!
PAISE TOO SNOWLEDGE!
Ice, you fell asleep!
Ask the best captain!

Colonel, there's something fishy going on here. Inside the building was a crowd of Monoliths, as if in a trance. Staring at a pile of rubbish and talking to it. The rubbish I surveyed and discovered an interesting thing. It's a kind of antenna. It's like someone's messing with her with the Monoliths, and these sessions are not being received like God's revelation.
It's all very strange. Someone is clearly running these fanatics. Okay, we'll talk about that later.
It's all very strange. Someone is running these fanatics. Okay, we'll talk about that later. The sentry still hasn't shown up. If you find him, let me know right away. Over and out.
Monolith, we can't hear you.
Why did you leave us?
We await your orders, Monolith.
Lieutenant Skerja reporting for duty.
Fucking Babai! How many of them are there?!
You know, I've been thinking, I think it's safer with you.
Here we are!
Shoot them before they wake up!
As soon as I knew you needed help, I immediately signed up as a volunteer, so come on, dzhigit, lead the way!
The recon team had the data along with a lump of analyte. The records mention a bookstore.
The recon team still had intel on the monolithic surveillance. No large gatherings, just patrols.
I found the group, all dead and someone shot, but no sign of them.

I can't understand how they managed to attack so suddenly, and no sign of them. That's weird. Major, we just picked up the Sentinel's signal. According to the coordinates, it's somewhere near the deli. Check it out, but don't get in my face. I'm relying on you, Major. Over and out.
Major, we need to find a recon team, find out what happened. It's a hell of a place. Tet, Major, you be careful out there and keep in touch.
They're fanatics, damn them, they need to be dealt with.
They're fanatics, damn them. And just one thing after another. We've got a sentry missing, no contact. No sign of him either. It's time we got to those bastards.
All right, I'll get you two fighters, not wait outside the facility. Over and out.

All right, I'll get you two fighters out instead of waiting outside the facility. Yeah, also. Just picked up the Sentinel's signal. The coordinates put him somewhere near the deli. If possible, take a look at it. Anyway, I'm relying on you, Major. Over and out.
Group, group, over. What's going on in there?
I can't understand how they managed to attack so suddenly, and no sign of them. That's weird. I need to consider a course of action, Major. On the phone.
Oh, the recon team has made contact.
No! What the fuck? Stop! Stay with me! Fucking hell! Hey, somebody! Get rid of that one! Nah!
You've got to get to Pripyat without incident. I don't know how you found that way.
We have nothing difficult here, you need skill and a little luck, so we were lucky, or maybe the zone rewarded patience. I've been with the scientists a long time!
Yeah, Herman got me too.
The sentry dead was behaving inappropriately, attacked me, near the point a controller was detected and destroyed.
Sentry's dead, acting inappropriately, attacking me. A controller was detected near the point, I had to move away.
The Controller has been destroyed!

Roger that, Major. Looks like the controller got the guy by the brains. It's a shame. He was a great guy. And with the recon team, apparently the same Petrushka. That thing caused them to attack each other. All right. Thank you. And there's no connection.
Roger that, Major. The checker must have taken it. Guys for brains. Shit, we gotta do something about this bastard. While he's here, we're taking a big risk.
Major, this is Kowalski, we've had another emergency, come here, I'll tell you all about it.

Major Atakowalski, we have an emergency. The Sentinel is not answering calls. You know, the degastronome was. Well, that's where his tracker signal's coming from. You check it out if you can. Over and out.
Ah, Major, come in, come in.
Get off me! Go away!
No! No! No! Noooooo!
Tell the colonel I found one of your guys. Looks like he blew himself up with a grenade. There were no signs of gunfire or other signs of combat.
Kowalski's here. I hear you, Major. Listen to me. We have good news. We finally got the exact coordinates of the radio interference source. The signal is coming from the kindergarten building.

The radio operator thinks the signal is jammed somewhere nearby. He's just trying to figure out the coordinates. I sent fighters to that area, but they're missing. Even the personal beacons are undetectable.

Major, we're fucked. Since the helicopters crashed, it's no longer an operation. Discussion. We're being taxed. There's no communication with the centre. And the situation is not expected to improve. There is no air evacuation to look forward to. The helicopters didn't come again. And with all these casualties among the boys, soon there won't be anyone left to evacuate. Control of the situation is gone. We're in desperate need of a link to the centre.
One of your tasks, Major, is to establish contact with the centre. In our situation, I believe it becomes paramount. Also, a personal favour - - find my fighters. Good.
Major, listen, there's a conversation we need to have.
I approached the building, but all the entrances are blocked.
The guys on the squad looking for the source of the interference had explosives. It's supposed to be used to clear the aisle.
The gunman and personnel of the stingray team are killed. Prepare the cutlet.
That's it. The shooter's dead. Prepare for departure.
Major Degtyarev here. Communication's good.
At this point, it has been possible to obtain documents on experiments in the Zone. In addition, we have a stalker who has been to Chernobyl. A.K.A. Shooter. He's willing to co-operate with us.
The shooter claims the helicopters hit anomalies. After each ejection, their location does not change, but this was not taken into account when mapping the operation fairway.

I got it. I've got solid intel, Shooter's intel only confirms it. The helicopters were struck by anomalies whose locations changed during the ejection. This was not read when the maps were drawn up before the operation, so the troopers died.
Give it a spin, hope it was worth it.
Once we jump on the chopper, then we'll talk. All right?
We'll have time to talk again, I'm not sure if I'll have enough ammo, if anything?
Well, thank you, our dear launderer, nothing that's how it turned out in the database. Now hurry up to the choppers and go home.
Let's do it later, eh? That release is jaw-dropping.
Another outburst! Whoo! I'm sick of it!
Hell, it's like being in a trench before a tank attack.
Рђ? What? Let's go!
It's here!
Yeah, I used to think a capez was a downpour in the Carpathians.
Ha, now that would be like sunbathing at a resort for you.
How'd it go down? Maybe some clever head will come up with some kind of literate escape route?
Dreamer, the ejection is diverted and served.
CONNECTING mmmmmmmmmm I THINK YOU'VE GOT YOUR HEAD UP YOUR ASS TAKE THREE
So you're the weather guy.
What was that?
Commander! Zambians!
There's about a dozen zombies in the building!
There's a building with about a dozen zombies in it!
Kowalski, why was there no communication?
Okay. All right, listen, operation fairway. Let's go, under your control. Major Dikterev, is he around?
He's in charge now. You're waiting. His commanders will be back with him now.
Dalatelatelatelatelatelatelatelatelatelatelatelatelatelat, you devils. The givens, after all. Shooter, you were right.
There's no time! Check your weapons! Open fire without command!
Major, can I have a word with you?
Okay, the outburst seems to have passed. Lieutenant, contact the centre.
Major, we can't wait any longer.
Prepare for battle!
Well, one last push!
Squad, let's move out!
Soldiers, fire at will! Let's go!
Soldiers, move to the left! Cover each other!
All right, men, you got it? Listen to my orders, in Putin, disperse, stay in a group, the stalker is a Zenitsuoka. You got any questions? That's fine. Getting ready to ship out.
Let's brew!
All hands on deck. Follow orders immediately and clearly. We're a stone's throw from the evacuation point. Let's go!
Shit, it's the Monoliths. Fighters, spare no bullets. Target selection is free. Keep moving towards the choppers.
Shit! The shooter's dead! If we want to live, we have to push on! Let's go!
A choice, Comrade General. Communication is impossible during it.
Yes.
Roger that.
Major, where are you? We need to get the shooter to the point!
Major, we have to keep moving.
Major, we have to keep moving.
Major, we can't wait for you much longer!
Major, we can't wait for you much longer!
Major, where are you? We need to get the shooter to the point.
So, we're moving on?
So, we're moving on?
We're on our way!
Copy that, guys? We'll try to make it.
Now any zombie in Pripyat knows we're here. We've got to move faster! Squad! Go!
Let's go! Squad to the right along the side of the building! Let's go!
Holy shit, you decided to stay. Well, if you need anything, come by the base. I'm back on site and this time I've brought the stalkers with me.
Comrade Major, we're under heavy fire! We can't identify the enemy! We won't last long!
Comrade Major, we're under heavy fire! We can't identify the enemy! We won't last long!
We can't wait. We have orders. If they attack, we take off.
Scud! We can't wait any longer! We're taking off in a minute!
Scud, we can't wait any longer. We're taking off in a minute.
Major, we're ready to take off!
Roger that?
To the choppers! Hurry up!
To the flyers! Hurry up!
A stingray band! Where are you located?
It's those things again, why don't we go round the building?

For his successful investigation, Dicterev was promoted to the extraordinary rank of colonel. Turning down a staff position offered to him, he cut out the urge to head for the zone, the constant observers from security.

Mercenary squads continue to operate in the zone. Their interest in the secret labs has increased markedly and managed to attract the close attention of the SBU. Nevertheless, identifying the customer behind behind the mercenaries, failed.

The area near Yanov station is attracting more and more stalkers. Absence of dangerous mutants and abundance of abnormal formations have led to these places becoming, in the stalker's mind to be associated with that very artifact trove.

The area near Janov station had gained a reputation as one of the most dangerous in the zone. Increasingly, stalkers did not return from outings. The mutants were killing them almost at the very walls of the camp. One of the missing was a zookeeper who had gone on his last chimera hunt.

Zolos returned to the main debt base at the Rostock factory. No one knows what he talked to General Voronen about, but a few days later, Zolos was seen at the head of a large unit heading towards the centre of the zone.

Rumours of Zulu's fate reached the commander of the Dolg, General Voronin. To everyone's amazement, Voronin presented Zulus with the Order of the Silver Shield, the Dolg's highest honour. Posthumously.

Wono has gone to the army depots to freedom, where the ease of of character and optimism quickly earned him all the attention of the general sympathy. Eventually, he led a small group of researchers, that has taken up the study of anomalies.

The Stalkers of Yanov station sometimes remember the cheerful Vono, his cheerfulness and his skills as a born Stalker. Everyone agreed that Vono with his luck shouldn't have looked for a way into Pripyat.

There is a new group of stalkers in the zone. Prepared they're good, but their goals are unknown to anyone. According to unconfirmed rumour has it that all of these men were once monolith fighters. Lydia Rotunda is known by the nickname The Tramp.
Few noticed the disappearance of the Tramp, the only person who tried to understand what had happened to the Monoliths and help them.

Senior Lieutenant Sokolov continued to fly in the territory of the zone and was shot down by mercenaries over Limansk. A fortnight later, he, who had survived by some miracle, near the the cordon was picked up by a patrol. Sokolov soon left the Air Force and went into civilian life aviation.
Another line appeared on the list of personnel lost during Operation Farwater. Senior Lieutenant Sokolov O.N. was killed in the performance of military duty.
Cheech has made some good connections with customers outside the zone. Its commodity is information. Rumour has it that much of his information goes to the SBU.

During a particularly powerful outburst, a group of stalkers was forced to seek shelter in an old barge. Soon the ship was attacked by snorkels, and the boys realised that they were ended up in a small but decent fortress. A litter of pseudo-dog puppies caused particular amazement, who helped defend the barge against the mutants.

Cardan, having learnt the fate of his friends, thought no more of the stalker career. After overcoming his alcohol addiction, he moved on to Janov, where, together with Azot, he organised a workshop on repairing everything. In their spare time, both technicians are passionate about design a means of transport to maximise suitable for the extreme conditions of the zone.

Having overcome his alcohol addiction, Kardan left Kadovska. Stalker was said to be looking for his missing comrades. A few days later, out of the wounded irradiated, gimbal went out to Janov station, but he barely got well enough to leave out of the zone for good.

The shooter handed over to the SBU leadership the loot from the station data. This information prompted the government to create a of the Chernobyl Research Institute of the anomalous zone. Its chief scientific adviser was the following the shooter himself.

The shooter's knowledge was lost with him. Extracted from the CS-information that could have to help unravel the mystery zone, never made it to higher ground. The forbidden territories are secure keep their secrets.

Information on psy-ops extracted by Major Dikterev, has alarmed his management team. All IR materials with the lab have been removed from the military of the archives and are labelled of special importance. SBU officers in the zone were ordered to prevent at all costs dissemination of information on the essence of the works carried out.

The commander of the Scud group, Colonel Kovalsky, after returning from the zone, reported to his superiors about the reasons for the failure of Operation Farvator. After a long trial and many attempts to shift the blame, the Colonel resigned with honour.

Colonel Kowalski, commander of the Skat group, remained where most of his squad was. The bodies were swallowed up by the zone. And now all that reminds about these people - photos in mourning frames on the honourable stand to the special museum.

Several prototypes were created on the basis of the industrial documentation of product number 62. After the tests, it was decided to abandon the mass use of this weapon. The cost of ammunition proved too high. However, some facts suggest that the improvement of the gauss-gun was tacitly continuing.

After all attempts to take control of Skadovsk failed, the Sultan and his gang abandoned ship. With the disappearance of this danger, the feeble stream of stalkers and artefacts turned into a raging torrent. The beard business began to flourish, and Skadovsk is almost as popular as the Storringen Bar.

Naskadowski has finally established himself as consultan and the ship became a base for the bandits. Beard, unwilling to pay tribute to the boys, along with the band of stalkers moving into uncharted parts of the zone. The stalkers' attempts to restore the status quo ante quickly faded away. The showy dispatches to the dump did the trick.

Skadovsk has remained a refuge for all those who were lucky enough to to get to him. The bandits were persistent in their endeavours to establish themselves on the vessel orders, but the stalkers successfully countered it. Day after day stretched unsteady after quiet.

But even that didn't last long, the bloodsuckers that dwelt in a lair nearby had rammed their way to the ship. After the attacks started happening even during the day, people went on a raid. Unfortunately, they failed to clear the tunnels, and soon another wave of predators flooded Skadovsk.

After destroying the lair bloodsucker in the zone creatures could no longer interfere with the flow of life here. For a time, the old ship became a centre of relative stability in the volatile world of the zone.

The Freedom Group has been able to earn the trust of the stalkers at Janov station. In an attempt to regain lost ground, the Debt has organised armed attacks, but in this skirmish he was killed Lieutenant Colonel Shulga. Without a commander, the Dolg squad has ceased its Existence.
Increased numbers and popularity among stalkers allowed long enough to push the freedom fighters out of the station Janov. After a fierce battle, the freedom squad led by the Sloki was destroyed.

A precarious equilibrium has been established between the freedom and duty squads at Janov Station. Weary of pointless fighting, the fighters of the warring factions began to join the ranks of free stalkers.

Scientific research expedition of Prof Herman Yazersky was successful in gathering data assisted in the development of several unique devices or cartel drugs. In light of this funding for the Area Watch programme has been multiplied many times over.

A scientific research expedition by Professor Azersky in Germany failed to collect enough data and was curtailed. After returning to Bolshaya Zemlya, both scientists engaged in activities unrelated to the zone.

Garrick's tales of the military's struggle against the dangers of Pripyat interested many, and soon with the forces of disparate groups began exploring the city of Prytrak. Despite constant attacks by Monolith fighters, the stalkers managed to gain a foothold in the former military camp and now make forays from there into the depths of the city, each time moving further and further away.

Garrick's account of the fate of the military scared off the stalkers from Pripyat. The few who dared to visit it encountered with inexplicable and frightening phenomena, which only added to the grim touches to the face of a dead city.

The stories of Azis are no longer legends. More and more often in the conversations of stalkers mentioned those who were able to find the way to this secret anomaly. The flow of seekers does not run out, and the bandits continue to take advantage of it. The newcomers fall for the offer to show them the way to Azis, but usually end up robbing them somewhere away from the stalker paths.
That's right!
The centre's on the line!
Major, do you copy? Come in!
Good. You will be put in charge of completing Operation Farwater. Kowalski and his Scud unit will assist you. Report the current situation.
I see. Co-operate. We have information on why the helicopters crashed.

Now we're counting. That means we have time before the next blowout. You and the stalker will be picked up at point B28. The Scud group is evacuating with you. Helicopters are already taking to the air. Over and out.
Keep moving! Go!
There are more zombies ahead!
Let's go!
Nice shooting!
Nice shooting.
Get up against the wall! Those things are coming out from all sides!
Get up against the wall! Those things are coming out from all sides!
Take that, you bastards!
What did you think? You'll get him!
What a bunch of bastards!
Notorious stalker, you're the one who disabled the burner.
I'll check it out.
I don't see anyone.
It's starting to blow!
All right, I'll come round.
So it's underground.
The centre should be informed at the earliest opportunity.
I see.
We're in trouble, helicopters are crashing for some unknown reason.
Id.
Ha, no way, no, I've never heard of that, it's got to be in the fridge.
Also, Garik's gone to Janov Station to resupply. He asked me to tell you that he would be away for a few days.
Yes, also, Vono asked me to tell you that Nayanov left with Garik. He said he'd come back with souvenirs.
Thanks for your help. The colonel asked you to come in.
That's exactly what the colonel has, but the signal periodically disappears and its source moves.
Got a signal. It's back on. Transmitting coordinates.
Wow, wow, you're back, we thought we'd never see it again more than our doctor.
All right. (chuckles)
YOU'RE A SKEWER!
The signal's gone.
He's here! Right next to you!
Close! It's close! Moving towards our base!
Tashch-Volkonik! A radio source detected near the base. The transmission is encrypted, it was not possible to decrypt it promptly.
What fridge? Where did you find a fridge?
So what happened?
Which one is that?
So, where have you been?
Yeah, we had a detailed map of the anomaly. The helicopters are stuffed full of emission defences.
Until that very reason is clarified, there are more helicopters it won't. We'll have to walk to the edge of the zone on our own.
coordinates are available Lieutenant
Major, this is Kowalski. You should go back. We need to prepare properly in case of an attack. Good thing they won't catch us like that now.
After the ejection, I'll contact command immediately.

The chief of staff came on the line, I reported the situation, passed on the information he'd gathered. No helicopters yet. We're being asked to hold on to our positions to wait for orders. The headquarters now has SBU observers, so you can talk to your own.
Lieutenant, liaise with HQ at your earliest convenience.
Come on, let's go talk in the shelter.
Monoliths again!
Who the hell are you?
So what now?
Hmm, even I don't know how to say this.
Where'd you find it? Where did you find it? I looked to see what you'd find in that condition.
You won't believe it, in the fridge.
Yeah, there was some stuff. Some other time.

That's weird. I'm surprised you haven't noticed yet. After emissions, the location of the anomaly usually changes. Some dissolve, but new ones appear. Your card is obsolete before it's even written to disc.
The reason is simple. There are as many anomalies in the air, especially near the centre of the zone, as there are on Earth.
I did, but the plan didn't work out. I've come to meet your superiors. I have information that will help take control and destroy the zone.
Don't shoot! I'm going to the main entrance!

Emissions don't happen in a row, one after another. If you can scan the area immediately after the ejection and plot the location of the anomaly, before the next outburst the helicopters will be there in time to pick everyone up.
I'm the Gunslinger!
Both targets eliminated. Well done. Stand down! Let's go!
Another group. Now let's see which one is the messenger.
Kirillov Atakovalsky, you must be escorted out, Major.
Near the main entrance of the likely commander.
First target eliminated.
First target lost. Approaching!
They're splitting up! Time to open fire!
Target is near the main entrance.
Comrade Major, attention! The mercenaries have arrived at the point!
The old target has been eliminated.
RF is lost! Pull back!
Both salts lost! Stand down! Fall back!
